kakāpua bhāi "FBS"; [in many Indo Aryan languages} the cousins are mostly described as brothers or sisters qualified by adjectives formed from the names of the kins who are their parent; in Oriya (and Assamese) instead of suffixing, the word for "son" is compounded [9];    sɔmpɔrki:jɔ bha:i / bhɔuɳi: "cousin brother/sister" (general term for all cousins (but differentiated to gender)  [292]
mausi-puva-bhai "mother's sister's son" (this is not correctly printed in Karve, by mistake it is put under FaSiSo which occurs twice) [223]
